author: iannorden
content:
No biggie, can add it in on the next PR if the need comes up down the road! 

Realizing now that the meaning of `TARGET_GASUSED` in `Let delta = block.gas_used - TARGET_GASUSED (possibly negative).` and
`Set BASEFEE = PARENT_BASEFEE + PARENT_BASEFEE * delta // TARGET_GASUSED // BASEFEE_MAX_CHANGE_DENOMINATOR` could maybe use some more clarification too. `TARGET_GASUSED` == `EIP1559_GAS_TARGET`, right? Or`TARGET_GASUSED` == `BLOCK_GAS_TARGET` (header.GasLimit field)? The two being equivalent after eip finalization but not during the transition.

author: sky.cactus
content: <@376568077950910466> Ah, good catch.  That should reference `EIP1559_GAS_TARGET`, not `TARGET_GAS_USED`.

author: 0xalizk
content: Is there a dataset anywhere containing historical gas prices used in every transaction in every block ?

author: 0xalizk
content: If not, is there a bandwidth-efficient way of obtaining it from Infura? I mean something better than simply requesting every tx of every block and extracting its `gasPrice`

author: sky.cactus
content: That information should be available to any full node, no need for an archive node I think.

author: sky.cactus
content: I would recommend doing it against your own local node rather than Infura, though I think either would work.

author: sky.cactus
content: I don't know of an "easier" way than just requesting all blocks (one at a time) and looking at each transaction receipt.

author: sky.cactus
content: With a local node it shouldn't take *too* long.

author: sky.cactus
content: I wouldn't want to wait for it to finish with a remote node.  ðŸ˜¬

author: 0xalizk
content: I don't have a local node  ðŸ˜¬  Im using infura for now

content: Are there any archive node service so far?

author: 0xalizk
content: I figured someone must have needed such data before and made it available (up to some block) for simple download
